title: Crippling design flaw in Jhin's Curtain Call
body:
OK, I just ran into this major problem with Jhin's ult in my last game: if you aim down towards the bottom-right corner of the screen, the fixed camera will leave quite a large slice of Curtain Call's target zone obscured by the minimap. I failed to kill Veigar in that last game because he ran down behind the minimap and, despite the area he was in still being visible to my team, I was basically shooting blind.

If activating the ult already zooms you out to a fixed angle, why can't it also make the minimap transparent (so you can still see champion icons moving around, but can also see actual _champions_ running behind it) for its duration? Or at the very least, don't lock the camera after zooming up so we can scroll to see what's under the minimap, at least a bit.

replies.body: Why are you playing with a fixed camera?

I play with a fixed camera as well. For some people its just easier to deal with. The only time I ever unlock the camera is if any of the champs abilities that I am using would work better with the camera unlocked like Xerath, J4, Kench etc.

Some people just cant use the unlocked camera. With me I cant do it because I usually end up losing track of where my champ is.
Press space bar to find your champion. If you'd like to move beyond 'elo hell' this is an important first step.

I know. But that doesn't help me though. I got so used to the camera lock I cant really play without it and pressing the space bar doesn't help because, like I told someone else a few comments down, I tried that with DOTA2 and its annoying.

But since I have played with the camera lock since I have started playing LoL 2 years ago, it has no bearing on my ranked play. The ranked problem is due to lack of teamwork from the other players and toxicity from other players.

I play better than a lot of people who don't use camera lock. Climbing in ranked has nothing to do with camera lock. If that is the way you play and it helps, then there is no problem.
Just try to start by holding the space bar all the time with camera unlocked. I keep it locked on my champ for the majority of the time, just releasing it to do certain things easier.

That is what DOTA2 forced me to do and why i said i found it very annoying because i didnt like the fact that i would have to keep my finger on the space bar the whole time.

I changed my key binding to have the V be to lock and unlock which made it easier to use certain champs abilities but as far as playing with it unlocked goes, i just cant, I guess its because when i first played this game i couldnt get the help tips off and kept locking the camera because of them and just got used to it. Then i found out how to turn them off but by then i was already used to the locked camera.
You can beat people by playing ping pong with a shovel, even winning some low level turnaments. But you are definitely crippling yourself by doing this.
I personally dont believe i am. Like i said before, everyone plays with how they feel comfortable. I play comfortably with camera lock and have no problem at all playing against anyone.
My point is you have to put more effort than your opponent to win if you play with such a handicap.

And thinking its a handicap is your opinion. That is my point.

I see no difference between my play and someone elses when it comes to locked or unlocked, the only difference is champ mechanics.

I always have map awareness due to the minimap which i am ALWAYS looking at but i dont need an unlocked camera to do that.

Im just saying that this is how i play and i do well for myself.

And i honestly cant see how a locked camera player would have to put more effort in than an unlocked camera player. That doesnt make any sense.

with locked camrera you can't quickly watch all the lanes to see how they are pushing/doing, you can't clic on a fresh ward to see who did put it, you can't watch what your allies are doing and if you need to ult as shen/soraka/tf, you can't land "out of screen" skillshots (jhin's w for example, lux ult), you can't check how much time is left on your shrooms as teemo, the timers on your wards on the map, how much hp your towers have, i dont even know how you do tp on the right minion, on zac's blobs to save him ...

You may see an opponent on the minimap but you dont know if he is going to gank you or if he is low life, low mana and isnt a threat but rather an easy kill.

For globals (teleport, etc) and skillshots that go off the screen it's normal to unlock regardless. I'm not going to try a cross-map snipe with Jinx unless I know where I'm aiming. You literally can't TP to a  minion or ward from the minimap. People can unlock camera and go look at specific things; they just use locked camera when they need to focus on the immediate area - which is most of the time, tbh. You're assuming that people who play locked-screen *never* unlock it, when really we just prefer not to deal with one more thing to keep track of all  the time.
Actually, you CAN tp to a ward from the minimap. The only thing you cant tp to with a locked camera is a minion.
Really? It never works when I try it...

I know, it does that a lot. I think it has to do with getting the right pixel on that minimap lol

I told my friends before that i had a problem tping to minions but wasnt allowed to but i could tp to wards and towers with no problem. Only then did they tell me to unlock my camera and it worked for the minions.
Ah. Pixel-perfect clicks are difficult with the giant cursor they give us.

I know you cant do all of that with a locked camera. That is why i dont do it. Im not the shot caller for my team so i dont need to pay attention to other lanes unless im sure my lane opponent is not near me. The only time i ever unlock my camera is when i use a champ ability or TP that requires me to do so.

Otherwise my camera stays locked because there would be no point to unlock it.
This was me a couple years ago. I eventually committed to playing unlocked and it sucked for a while, but its a nice improvement once you get used to it.
I believe there is a way to have it where it unlock camera when u press space bar instead of locking if you find holding space bar too annoying

I told someone else that this is what DOTA2 forces you to do and i dont like it.

I just got used to the locked camera so i just went with it.
actually it's not an "important first step." i'm plat 2 and i have been using locked camera the whole time
I would love to see actual statistics on this. But I'd be mighty surprised to find you the average.
I'd be mighty surprised to find out that plat was average too.
I meant those of us in Plat (and higher) using a locked screen.
Dont act like how you keep your camera is gonna keep you in low elo. Its just whether you have map awareness or not, and how you keep your camera isn't gonna change you being blinder than Lee Sin
I'm not saying it's THE cause. Perhaps my tone was too flippant. I was suggesting it was A cause.
honestly I've gotten used to just holding space bar. it makes the camera lock on to the target.

I have never done that with this game because I always turned the lock on but I have tried it with DOTA2 because there is no camera lock for it. I got so used to the camera lock with DOTA2 that I thought "how on earth are people able to do this?" lol
I'm 80% sure it has been in settings for years and you could also turn on locked camera in the console

I'm not. I've always played using Space to focus the unlocked camera. When you activate Curtain Call, the camera locks on its own.

I even just had another game on Jhin just to make sure I wasn't putting my foot in my mouth. You cannot scroll the camera while Curtain Call is active. At all.

> [{quoted}](name=Parceval,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pOIIrdj1,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2016-04-27T16:45:14.883+0000)
>
> Why are you playing with a fixed camera?

Even Doublelift has said he keeps the camera locked sometimes for Team Fights and such.  Sometimes it is easier to not have to worry about moving the camera around and just focus on positioning.  If one of the most mechanically skilled players to ever come out of NA is using it, it is a valid choice.  

I keep my camera locked with the spacebar as the toggle lock, so I can unlock if I need to quickly.  I am just not a good enough player to manage camera positioning and everything else at the same time.  

Most of the people I play with also lock, because it feels more natural for many of us.  We will never be diamond, and probably not even gold, but that is just fine with us.

I know a larger number of people who use a fixed camera than ones who don't.  I mostly use it myself, although I unlock for certain things (any long range ult going beyond the viewport by more than a few hundred units, especially ones involving movement (like Pantheon's, Shen's, and Tahm Kench's; as well as for TP).

Please find a Diamond+ level player that uses fixed camera, I would be incredibly surprised.

It's inherently a disadvantage.

EDIT: The only person I know that uses a fixed camera is stuck in low Bronze. Anecdotally, I would call that relevant.
Just because you have a personal belief doesnt mean what you say is any more valid than someone who is saying the opposite without evidence.

You have a 16-32 record in Bronze 3. It's likely that I am exposed to a much larger swath of higher tier play than you. In addition to just generally a lot more experience in the game. 

This is relevant evidence. When I polled my contacts in Master and Diamond tiers, none of them used a locked camera. Again, this is only my circles, but nearly every "LCS Big Play" I've done would have been impossible with a fixed camera.

I have that record because of bad teammates. I know that may sound like a classic "bronze" attitude, but my camera position has absolutely NOTHING to do with my ranked play. I have had winning streaks in norms before and my camera had nothing to do with it.

Your entire comment about climbing in ranked due to my camera being a big part of it is completely irrelevant. My ranked games mainly have to deal with teammates who like to feed and refuse to use teamwork, just like a lot of bronze players do. I am a very team oriented player but i cant do anything when my teammates refuse to help. So it has nothing to do with my camera and that is just you grasping at straws really.

And the poll you did is invalid mainly because it is people you know and not a wide variety of people. People who play with locked cameras are at no bigger disadvantage to playing than an unlocked camera user. Because all the people who play with either one are more than likely used to it and probably dont play champs that require unlocking the camera anyway.

I said it was my circles, and therefore it is of course anecdotal, just as your information is. However, it is from people two tiers above me, and five above you. 

If Lebron James said shooting with the back of your hand was a good idea, that would be more relevant than if a high school player said it. 

I am not suggesting that a locked screen is the source of ALL your problems by any means. I'm simply suggesting that, from where I'm sitting, it seems to me to put you at a disadvantage. 

Now there are situations where a locked screen could make sense. A hybrid solution is probably best, but, personally, I would prioritize unlocked for most activities.

As my original comment in this long thread stated, the only time I unlock the camera is when I use champs whos abilities require me to unlock it like GP, Jinx, Xerath, J4 etc. or when I use TP.

The rest of the time it is locked. But there is no difficulty in my play due to it.
Why not unlock it anyway?

As i have said before, if i dont, i end up losing track of my character and even though there is a toggle to put focus back on the champ, it is annoying for me to do that so i just leave the camera locked.

And as someone else has already said, all it does is handicap you. It isn't an opinion. It doesn't matter how you look at it, in the end it's just a handicap. You _are_ able to get used to the better way of doing it, but instead you'd rather call it an "opinion" because of what _you're_ used to.

I dont know how many times i have to say that it DOES NOT HANDICAP ME. I do not see the difference between me and my opponent other than champ mechanics.

Alright so i cant see the other lanes.....i dont need to if i am not using a global like an ult or TP. So i cant see the health of the opponent if they are off screen....that doesnt matter either because most of the time we dont have the vision that far up so i am not going to over extend regardless.

There is no handicap. I say it is an opinion because you can play with or without it. I choose to play with it because it is easier for me. Can i learn to play without it, im sure but i dont want to because it is too confusing for me and would just add to the frustration that i would already be dealing with.

I am at no more of a disadvantage than one who uses an unlocked camera. Sorry if you cant accept that but it IS a matter of opinion. And im not going to stop doing something just because YOU or anyone else thinks it not something YOU would do. Everyone has their own play style, this is mine and you, along with the others, have no right say that it is a handicap since you dont know how i play and have never seen me play.

And before you try to bring my ranked record into this like someone else did, let me point out that i dont play ranked often. I mainly play norms so my ranked record is not relevant to this argument.

Actually your ranked records are entirely relevant as where you stand on the ladder is about the only way to determine that your idea of it being an "opinion" is true, because everything else says otherwise.

Actually they are not for the simple reason that i have only played 48 ranked matches since the start of the season which has been almost 4 months now. If i played ranked regularly and had a much higher record (swinging either way) then i would agree that it is relevant. However, i DONT play regularly and tend to stay away from it, not because of my rank but because i dont feel like dealing with more trolls than i have to. Not to mention that this is the first season i played ranked so i have no history with ranked other than what is showing for this season, which is another reason why it is irrelevant since i have already played this game for 1 1/2- 2 years without even touching ranked until now.

I have more normal matches than i do ranked and i hardly play ranked. That is why the ranked matches are irrelevant. Now if you were to talk about my norms record, then by all means we can discuss that since that is mainly what i play. But you cannot make an argument going based partly off of my ranked record since the number of matches i have in that pales in comparison to how many norm matches i play.

Trying to say that my "barely there" record in ranked is relevant to this whole argument completely fails due to my explanation that not only do i barely play ranked but also because after playing this game for about 2 years this is the only time i have ever touched ranked. Because there is not enough experience by way of play time in ranked to make it a valid source for this argument.

Btw, just to add this, my record is 16-32 since the start of the season. It has been almost 4 months with only 48 ranked matches played. That record pales in comparison to the number of normal matches I play since i hardly played ranked.

But thank you for bringing up a completely irrelevant point.

I'd say its less a design flaw with Jhin's ult, more a design flaw with locked camera. 

Locked camera isn't the intended way to play, so its not going to receive a ton of support with every relevant issue. 

Something you could do is unlock the camera and get used to pressing space to center on your character when you lose track, or just all the time. This lets you pan around when you need to, then hit space to immediately center on your character again.

Practice that and you'll A) solve your current problem while effectively retaining locked camera's effects B) help yourself get used to keeping track of your character without locked camera.

You'll likely not need locked camera at all after some time of getting used to utilizing space, but space is still there if that floats your boat. :)
Jhin ult locks camera automatically. I don't PLAY with locked camera, ever, but obviously I hit this problem or I wouldn't even have made this thread.
It zooms it to fixed angle because of locked camera, it might be better to play with it unlocked while playing jhin, or anyone with an ability that extends out the screen.
No it doesn't. It zooms to fixed angle because that's what it's programmed to do, irrespective of your camera settings. It's like Sion ult.

I never really have this problem, but that's because you can still pan around the zoomed-out camera if it's unlocked. If someone's out of my view when I ult, I just nudge the camera over so I can see the entire cone.
